intro: Cyrtandra kauensis, commonly known as the Kauai cyrtandra, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian island of Kauai. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and streamside habitats. It has heart-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
